metadata.title: CVE-2017-17689 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The S/MIME specification allows a Cipher Block Chaining (CBC)malleability-gadget attack that can indirectly lead to plaintextexfiltration, aka EFAIL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17689` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kmail package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
